org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.hardware

Class HardwareMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.hardware.Mechanism
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.hardware.HardwareMain

  • public class HardwareMain
extends Mechanism
    HardwareMain is the class that is used to define all of the hardware for a single robot. In this case, the robot is: Relic Recovery. This class contains autonomous actions involving multiple mechanisms. These actions may be common to more than one routine.

      • HardwareMain

        public HardwareMain(com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode opMode)
        Overloaded constructor for HardwareMain. Calls the default constructor and sets the OpMode context for the robot.
        Parameters:
        opMode - the LinearOpMode that is currently running

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hwMap)
        Initializes all mechanisms on the robot.
        Parameters:
        hwMap - robot's hardware map

      • jewel

        public int jewel(boolean isAllianceRed)
        Autonomous action for scoring the jewel. Uses the robot's arm mechanism to detect jewel color and moves forwards or backwards accordingly. This assumes the color sensor faces the front of the bot.
        Parameters:
        isAllianceRed - whether or not the robot is on the Red Alliance
        Returns:
        number of inches moved, with respect to the original position

      • scoreGlyph

        public void scoreGlyph(int targetCol)
        Autonomous action for scoring a glyph. Uses the robot's distance sensor to detect the robot's position using the cryptobox wall. Moves parallel to cryptobox until the target column is reached. This assumes the distance sensor faces the cryptobox wall.
        Parameters:
        targetCol - the cryptobox column that is being targeted (left is 0, center is 1, right is 2)
